browserSearchPath: CLMS Bio-geophysical Parameters, Auxiliary data, Cloud Mask
collectionDescription: The Cloud Classification (CC) product provides information on the extent of clouds and cloud shadows derived from optical satellite data acquired by the Sentinel-2 constellation. It is generated in near real-time at European scale, with a pixel spacing of 20 m x 20 m. Cloud detection is performed at a 120m spatial resolution. It is available for the period from 2016 to the present and used to produce the CLMS High-Resolution Water, Snow and Ice datasets (HR-WSI), which rely on Sentinel-2 imagery. More information in the products documentation here.

layers.shortDescription: Cloud and cloud shadow classification of the Sentinel-2 image
layers.longDescription: Classification of the Sentinel-2 image using the MAJA cloud screening and atmospheric correction software, developed by CNES and CESBIO with contributions from DLR. Cloud detection is performed at a spatial resolution of 120 m.

layers.shortDescription: Quality layer for the cloud and cloud shadow classification (CC) layer
layers.longDescription: Quality layer providing basic assessment of the cloud and cloud shadow classification layer.

Bitmask layer with pixel quality flags. The default visualisation highlights pixels where clouds have been detected using a single-scene, threshold-based approach. These pixels correspond to locations where bit 0 is set. Other information can also be visualised. More details are available in the '</> Custom' option.
